awd_titl_txt: Broadening Engagement — A Spanish Language Astronomy Webinar Series
awd_abstract_narration:
The American Association of Variable Star Observers (AAVSO) will introduce a free pilot webinar series in Astronomy, conducted exclusively in Spanish, targeting Hispanic/Latino audiences in the USA and beyond. The webinars will feature successful scholars from the professional astronomical community. The focus of the presentations will be aspects of recent developments in astronomy and space science, introducing scientific data and data analysis techniques and providing avenues for research using citizen science data.  By making astronomical content available to Spanish-speaking audiences, the program will promote broader involvement in citizen science (through the AAVSO’s existing on-line portals) and encourage the entry of young members of this underrepresented group into STEM careers.

Astronomy has always triggered human imagination and is considered a gateway to increase familiarity with scientific terms, build an understanding of data acquisition and analysis techniques, bring the public closer with scientists, and foster trust and positive relationships with science.  The webinar series aims to introduce basic science concepts, provide opportunities for casual discussions and interactions between presenters and participants, introduce strong positive role models, and increase trust in the scientific method among members of minority communities.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
In 2023-2024, the American Association of Variable Star Observers organized and presented a series of twelve monthly webinars on selected topics in basic astronomy, intended for the Spanish-speaking general public and presented in Spanish by native speakers. The presenters are mostly in early career stages, and half are female. All are experts on their topics. The aims of the project were to increase astronomical knowledge in this segment of the public and provide them with a gateway to citizen science.

 

The title of the series was: "La Ciencia del Cielo para Principiantes (2023-24)." Details about it, including the schedule of presenters, can be found on the website (in Spanish): https://www.aavso.org/2023-seminarios-web. The topics were: introduction to the sky; operation of a modern observatory; stars; our galaxy; extragalactic astronomy; gravitational waves and black holes; the solar system; space science; planetary exploration; exploration of the Moon; exoplanets; and introduction to citizen science.

    

Audiences connected from all over the Americas. Although our outreach was limited and audiences small, responses to post-webinar surveys were strongly positive. All the webinars were recorded, and the YouTube videos have received many times more views than the live webinars themselves. Thus, an important outcome of this project is a permanent, freely available internet resource in Spanish on basic astronomy. The YouTube playlist is: https://bit.ly/3TE89uM
